title: About me
text:
Interests
Iâ€™m especially interested in (morpho)syntactic phenomena such as non-canonical passive constructions and long-distance dependencies. My work is mainly focused on German and tries to combine descriptive approaches, empirical evidence, and minimal-generative perspectives. In my dissertation and as part of my work in project A01 (), I explore whether exceptional extraction from islands can be explained by analogy. My PIs and supervisors are Jutta M. Hartmann and AndrÃ¡s BÃ¡rÃ¡ny.
Iâ€™m also interested in historical linguistics and language change â€“ in particular, in questions such as what motivates grammaticalization processes and how these can be modeled syntactically.

title: curriculum vitae
text:
Current Position

Since May, 2024: I am scientific staff and PhD candidate at Bielefeld University
Project: Creativity in (morpho)syntactic variation. The role of analogy
within CRC 1646: Linguistic Creativity in Communication



Previous Positions

2023 â€“ 2025: I was an external lecturer at Ruhr University Bochum (German studies and historical linguistics). I taught two courses on (morpho)syntax of historical German (within the generative framework) and a practice course on grammaticalization and corpus research.
10/2022 â€“ 12/2023: Student assistant and tutor, graduate (WHK) | German Studies, Chair: Historical Linguistics, Prof.Â Dr.Â Eric FuÃŸ | Ruhr University Bochum
10/2021 â€“ 12/2023: Student Assistant, graduate (WHK) | German Studies, Dr.Â Judith Berman | Ruhr University Bochum
04/2021 â€“ 09/2021: Student Assistant, undergraduate (SHK) | German Studies, Dr.Â Judith Berman | Ruhr University Bochum



Education

2021 â€“ 2024 | M.A.Â German Studies (with distinction) | at Ruhr University Bochum | Thesis: Was zu beschreiben ist: Nicht-kanonische Passivstrukturen im Deutschen (Supervision: Eric G. Fuss & Karin Pittner)
2018 â€“ 2021 | B.A. Major: German Studies & History, Minor: Optionalbereich mit Profil Lehramt (=Education) | at Ruhr University Bochum | Thesis: Zur korrelativen Subordination bei satzwertigen Komplementen (Supervision: Judith Berman & Karin Pittner)
